channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report X-2023111284
item.description:
Report X-2023111284

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-17
  • City: OSHKOSH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE DISCOVERED IN A TRAILER LEAKING. PACKAGE HAD MULTIPLE CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS ON IT. TRAILER WAS IMMEADIATELY EVACTUATED AND FIRST RESPONDER NOTIFIED. RESPONDER TESTED THE LIQUID. THE ACID WAS NEUTRALIZED WITH SODIUM BICARBONATE AND ABSORBED WITH ZEP ZORBANT MATERIAL.

item.title: Report X-2023110749
item.description:
Report X-2023110749

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-03
  • City: CUDAHY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: box left for QA wet and leaking, not visibly damaged otherwise DescribePack: inside, 1 of 2 4-liter plastic bottles of liquid ethanol had leaked approximately 2.2 liters through unsecure cap, soaking box DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: placed in plastic tote under ventilator hood
